events.name: UK Sanctions on Russia
events.wd_description: The UK has announced 65 new sanctions targeting strategic industries, banks, and business elites aiding Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, bringing the total sanctioned individuals and businesses to over 1,000 since the invasion.
events.description: The UK has announced 65 new sanctions targeting strategic industries, banks, and business elites aiding Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, bringing the total sanctioned individuals and businesses to over 1,000 since the invasion.

events.name: New Sanctions Announcement
events.wd_description: Foreign Secretary Liz Truss announced 65 new sanctions against a range of key strategic industries and individuals supporting Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
events.description: Foreign Secretary Liz Truss announced 65 new sanctions against a range of key strategic industries and individuals supporting Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

events.name: Key Targets of Sanctions
events.wd_description: The sanctions target industries and individuals supporting the invasion, including Russian Railways, Kronshtadt, Wagner Group, Alfa Bank, Alrosa, and several high-profile individuals.
events.description: The sanctions target industries and individuals supporting the invasion, including Russian Railways, Kronshtadt, Wagner Group, Alfa Bank, Alrosa, and several high-profile individuals.

events.name: Industries Targeted
events.wd_description: Sanctions target key industries supporting the invasion, such as Russian Railways, Kronshtadt, and the Wagner Group.
events.description: Sanctions target key industries supporting the invasion, such as Russian Railways, Kronshtadt, and the Wagner Group.

events.name: Individuals Targeted
events.wd_description: Sanctions target individuals including Eugene Shvidler, Oleg Tinkov, Herman Gref, and Polina Kovaleva, among others.
events.description: Sanctions target individuals including Eugene Shvidler, Oleg Tinkov, Herman Gref, and Polina Kovaleva, among others.

events.name: Impact and Measures
events.wd_description: The sanctions include asset freezes, travel bans, and transport sanctions, aiming to degrade the Russian economy and prevent sanctioned individuals from conducting business in the UK.
events.description: The sanctions include asset freezes, travel bans, and transport sanctions, aiming to degrade the Russian economy and prevent sanctioned individuals from conducting business in the UK.

events.name: Asset Freeze
events.wd_description: The asset freeze prevents any UK citizen or business from dealing with funds or economic resources owned, held, or controlled by the designated person.
events.description: The asset freeze prevents any UK citizen or business from dealing with funds or economic resources owned, held, or controlled by the designated person.

events.name: Travel Ban
events.wd_description: The travel ban prevents designated individuals from entering or remaining in the UK.
events.description: The travel ban prevents designated individuals from entering or remaining in the UK.

events.name: Transport Sanctions
events.wd_description: Transport sanctions make it a criminal offense for any Russian aircraft to fly or land in the UK, and ban Russian ships from UK ports.
events.description: Transport sanctions make it a criminal offense for any Russian aircraft to fly or land in the UK, and ban Russian ships from UK ports.

events.name: North Korea missile tests
events.wd_description: Beginning on January 5, North Korea initiated a new round of missile tests over the Sea of Japan, aiming to circumvent American and Japanese missile defense technologies.
events.description: Beginning on January 5, North Korea initiated a new round of missile tests over the Sea of Japan, aiming to circumvent American and Japanese missile defense technologies.

events.name: missile tests
events.wd_description: North Korea began missile tests over the Sea of Japan on January 5.
events.description: North Korea began missile tests over the Sea of Japan on January 5.

events.name: defense circumvention
events.wd_description: The missile tests are targeted toward circumventing American and Japanese missile defense technologies in the region.
events.description: The missile tests are targeted toward circumventing American and Japanese missile defense technologies in the region.

events.name: diplomatic preemption
events.wd_description: Some analysts suspect the missile tests are intended to preempt a new push for diplomatic engagement with the U.S.
events.description: Some analysts suspect the missile tests are intended to preempt a new push for diplomatic engagement with the U.S.

events.name: sanctions
events.wd_description: The U.S. has leveraged severe sanctions against North Korea due to its missile programs.
events.description: The U.S. has leveraged severe sanctions against North Korea due to its missile programs.

events.name: Russian Attack on Ukraine
events.wd_description: Russian forces have begun an attack on Ukraine, with reports of troops crossing the border, explosions in multiple cities, and warnings from Russian President Vladimir Putin.
events.description: Russian forces have begun an attack on Ukraine, with reports of troops crossing the border, explosions in multiple cities, and warnings from Russian President Vladimir Putin.

events.name: Initial Attack
events.wd_description: The offensive that Russia called a “special military operation” began with blasts heard around 5 a.m. Thursday, targeting various Ukrainian cities including the capital Kyiv.
events.description: The offensive that Russia called a “special military operation” began with blasts heard around 5 a.m. Thursday, targeting various Ukrainian cities including the capital Kyiv.

events.name: Invasion Strategy
events.wd_description: Russian troops crossed the border to the north and south of Ukraine, with explosions reported in multiple cities.
events.description: Russian troops crossed the border to the north and south of Ukraine, with explosions reported in multiple cities.

events.name: Statements from Putin
events.wd_description: Putin announced a military operation in the Donbas region and threatened any country that attempts to intervene on Ukraine's behalf.
events.description: Putin announced a military operation in the Donbas region and threatened any country that attempts to intervene on Ukraine's behalf.

events.name: Ukrainian Response
events.wd_description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky enacted martial law, and Ukrainian forces have taken on the first blow of the enemy and are resisting.
events.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky enacted martial law, and Ukrainian forces have taken on the first blow of the enemy and are resisting.

events.name: Zelensky's Statements
events.wd_description: Zelensky appealed for peace but vowed that Ukraine would defend itself against the Russian attack.
events.description: Zelensky appealed for peace but vowed that Ukraine would defend itself against the Russian attack.

events.name: Martial Law Declaration
events.wd_description: Zelensky moved to enact martial law as air raid sirens rang out across Kyiv.
events.description: Zelensky moved to enact martial law as air raid sirens rang out across Kyiv.

events.name: International Reactions
events.wd_description: Immediate condemnation from the United States and its allies, with threats of “full scale” sanctions against Russia.
events.description: Immediate condemnation from the United States and its allies, with threats of “full scale” sanctions against Russia.

events.name: US Response
events.wd_description: US President Joe Biden issued a statement condemning Russia's attack and promising a united and decisive response.
events.description: US President Joe Biden issued a statement condemning Russia's attack and promising a united and decisive response.

events.name: EU Response
events.wd_description: EU leaders promised to weaken Russia’s economic base and capacity to modernize through sanctions.
events.description: EU leaders promised to weaken Russia’s economic base and capacity to modernize through sanctions.

events.name: UN Involvement
events.wd_description: The UN Security Council met to call for a peaceful resolution to the crisis, with US Ambassador Linda Thomas-Greenfield saying Putin had “delivered a message of war.”
events.description: The UN Security Council met to call for a peaceful resolution to the crisis, with US Ambassador Linda Thomas-Greenfield saying Putin had “delivered a message of war.”

events.name: Ground Situation
events.wd_description: Ukraine's borders are under attack from Russian forces, with explosions heard in multiple cities and residents fleeing Kyiv.
events.description: Ukraine's borders are under attack from Russian forces, with explosions heard in multiple cities and residents fleeing Kyiv.

events.name: Border Attacks
events.wd_description: Russian troops attacked border units, patrol borders, and checkpoints with artillery, heavy equipment, and small arms.
events.description: Russian troops attacked border units, patrol borders, and checkpoints with artillery, heavy equipment, and small arms.

events.name: Civilian Impact
events.wd_description: Civilians are seen leaving Kyiv and seeking shelter in subway stations, with concerns over the safety of residents amidst the attacks.
events.description: Civilians are seen leaving Kyiv and seeking shelter in subway stations, with concerns over the safety of residents amidst the attacks.

events.name: Indonesia EV Battery Supply Chain Development
events.wd_label: Indonesia EV Battery Supply Chain Development
events.wd_description: Indonesia aims to develop an integrated electric vehicle (EV) supply chain to become an EV battery producer and exporter. The goal is to make batteries with a capacity of 140 GWh by 2030, leveraging its nickel reserves and attracting foreign investments in battery production.
events.description: Indonesia aims to develop an integrated electric vehicle (EV) supply chain to become an EV battery producer and exporter. The goal is to make batteries with a capacity of 140 GWh by 2030, leveraging its nickel reserves and attracting foreign investments in battery production.

events.name: Upstream Supply Chain Development
events.wd_description: Indonesia leverages its abundant nickel reserves and applies restrictive measures to attract foreign investments in nickel processing. The country imposed an export ban on unprocessed nickel ore to encourage local processing.
events.description: Indonesia leverages its abundant nickel reserves and applies restrictive measures to attract foreign investments in nickel processing. The country imposed an export ban on unprocessed nickel ore to encourage local processing.

events.name: Nickel Processing Projects
events.wd_description: Several nickel processing projects have started in Indonesia, mainly due to Chinese investments. These projects will be key to future global nickel supply for batteries.
events.description: Several nickel processing projects have started in Indonesia, mainly due to Chinese investments. These projects will be key to future global nickel supply for batteries.

events.name: Export Ban on Unprocessed Nickel
events.wd_description: The export ban on unprocessed nickel ore was imposed to encourage local processing and add value to the mined nickel ore.
events.description: The export ban on unprocessed nickel ore was imposed to encourage local processing and add value to the mined nickel ore.

events.name: Midstream and Downstream Development
events.wd_description: Indonesia offers incentives for EV battery producers, EV manufacturers, and EV buyers to develop the domestic EV market and reduce greenhouse gas emissions. The government mandates the development of a domestic EV industry as a national priority.
events.description: Indonesia offers incentives for EV battery producers, EV manufacturers, and EV buyers to develop the domestic EV market and reduce greenhouse gas emissions. The government mandates the development of a domestic EV industry as a national priority.

events.name: Incentives for EV Industry
events.wd_description: The government offers fiscal and non-fiscal incentives for companies in the EV industry, including tax exemptions, import duty exemptions, and reduced electricity tariffs at charging stations.
events.description: The government offers fiscal and non-fiscal incentives for companies in the EV industry, including tax exemptions, import duty exemptions, and reduced electricity tariffs at charging stations.

events.name: Local Content Requirements
events.wd_description: The government requires EV manufacturers to use domestically manufactured goods, increasing to 80 percent by 2030, to promote local production.
events.description: The government requires EV manufacturers to use domestically manufactured goods, increasing to 80 percent by 2030, to promote local production.

events.name: EV Adoption Targets
events.wd_description: Indonesia has set a target of having 13 million electric motorcycles and 2.2 million electric cars on the roads by 2030 to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
events.description: Indonesia has set a target of having 13 million electric motorcycles and 2.2 million electric cars on the roads by 2030 to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

events.name: Investment and Partnerships
events.wd_description: Indonesia's ability to reach its goal of producing 140 GWh by 2030 depends on attracting substantial foreign investment. South Korea's Hyundai and LGES are building the country's first EV battery plant, and China's CATL plans to invest $5 billion in Indonesia.
events.description: Indonesia's ability to reach its goal of producing 140 GWh by 2030 depends on attracting substantial foreign investment. South Korea's Hyundai and LGES are building the country's first EV battery plant, and China's CATL plans to invest $5 billion in Indonesia.

events.name: Hyundai and LGES Investment
events.wd_description: Hyundai and LGES are building Indonesia’s first EV battery plant with a planned annual production capacity of 10 GWh, scheduled to start production in 2024.
events.description: Hyundai and LGES are building Indonesia’s first EV battery plant with a planned annual production capacity of 10 GWh, scheduled to start production in 2024.

events.name: CATL Investment
events.wd_description: China’s CATL plans to invest $5 billion in Indonesia, with its recycling arm Brunp already investing in a nickel processing project.
events.description: China’s CATL plans to invest $5 billion in Indonesia, with its recycling arm Brunp already investing in a nickel processing project.

events.name: Tesla Investment Consideration
events.wd_description: Tesla has shown interest in investing in Indonesia, but concerns over ESG issues and the challenging business environment have made the company reluctant.
events.description: Tesla has shown interest in investing in Indonesia, but concerns over ESG issues and the challenging business environment have made the company reluctant.
